content.p: This page sets out the University's right to withdraw an offer of admission to one of its programmes if certain conditions are met. Its content is primarily aimed at prospective students to all of the UK, China and Malaysia campuses. Includes: conditions of admission; the University's right to withdraw an offer It is a condition of admission to a programme of study that the candidate has accurately and truthfully presented all of the relevant facts in their application. The University retains the right to withdraw an offer of a place or terminate the registration of a student should it subsequently come to light that the information provided by an applicant in support of their application was inaccurate, incomplete or a misrepresentation of the applicant's academic and other achievements.
